explanations: The particle は indicates that the noun before it is the topic of the sentence
です used here shows politeness to the listener
[Note] the particle は is read as わ
examples: 1) 私[わたし]は ケンワイ です。
1) I am KenWhy
2) 私[わたし]は 会社員[かいしゃいん] です。
2) I am a company employee

topic: Noun1 は Noun2 じゃ/では ありません
explanations: じゃ/では ありません is the negative form of です
じゃ ありません is used in spoken conversations
では ありません is used in formal speech and writing
[Note] the particle は in では is read as わ
examples: 1) サントさんは 学生[がくせい] じゃありません。
1) サントさんは 学生[がくせい] ではありません。
1) Mr Santos is not a student

topic: Noun1 は Noun2 ですか
explanations: The particle か at the end of the sentence indicates that it is a question
A question usually ends with a rising intonation
Replies to a yes/no question usaully begins with はい for agreement and いいえ for disagreement
An iterrogative question replaces
examples: 1) ミラーさんは アメリカじんですか。
1) Is Mr Miller an American?
1) ... はい，アメリカじんです。
1) ... Yes, he is an American
1) ... いいえ，アメリカじんじゃありません。
1) ... No, he is not an American

explanations: も is used when the same things applies to what was stated previously
examples: 1) ミラーさん は 先生[せんせい]です。グプタさん も 先生[せんせい]です
1) Mr Miller is a teacher. Mr Gupta is also a teacher

explanations: When a noun Noun1 modifies a following noun Noun2, の is used to connect the two nouns
Other uses include when Noun1 explains what Noun2 is about
And when Noun1 indicates who owns Noun2
examples: 1) ミラーさんは IMCの社員[しゃいん]です。
1) Mr Miller is an employee of IMC
2) これは コンピューターの 本[ほん]です。
2) This is a book on computers
3) これは 私[わたし]の 本[ほん]です。
3) This is my book

explanations: さん is added to the name or family name of another person to show respect
Do not add さん to your own name when speaking about yourself
ちゃん is added to small children names instead of さん to indicate familiarity
[Note] あなた which means 'you', is only used for someone who you are very familiar with
To be polite, use their name with さん whenever addressing someone or drop あなた entirely if it is implied
examples: 1) ミラーさんは IMCの社員[しゃいん]です。
1) Mr Miller is an employee of IMC
